name: Eraser
description: Eraser is a collaborative platform for engineering teams to create, edit, and share technical documentation and diagrams.
longDescription: Eraser is a specialized platform designed for engineering teams to streamline the creation and management of technical documentation and diagrams. It integrates markdown-compatible editing, AI-powered diagramming, and real-time collaboration tools to enhance productivity. The platform supports diagram-as-code, allowing users to generate and modify diagrams using simple code syntax, which integrates seamlessly with GitHub for version control. Eraser aims to simplify complex workflows by offering intuitive tools for engineers, product managers, and technical writers. Its mission is to enable teams to focus on ideas and design at the speed of thought, reducing the friction of traditional diagramming tools. The platform is SOC II Type 2 certified, ensuring enterprise-grade security for its users.
features: Diagram-as-code functionality allows users to create diagrams using simple syntax, streamlining the design process.
AI-powered diagram generation creates flowcharts, ER diagrams, and cloud architecture diagrams from natural language or code prompts.
Real-time collaboration enables teams to edit documents and diagrams simultaneously, improving workflow efficiency.
GitHub integration ensures diagrams and documentation stay up-to-date with codebase changes through version control.
Markdown-compatible editor simplifies technical documentation with a familiar, lightweight format.
AI reference library allows enterprise users to upload custom templates for tailored diagram generation.
Keyboard-driven interface and minimal UI enable rapid creation and editing of diagrams and documents.
SOC II Type 2 certification provides enterprise-grade security for sensitive technical data.

faqs.question: What types of diagrams can Eraser generate?
faqs.answer: Eraser supports flowcharts, entity relationship diagrams, cloud architecture diagrams, sequence diagrams, and more, generated via AI or code.

faqs.question: Does Eraser offer a free plan?
faqs.answer: Yes, Eraser provides a free plan with limited features, including 20 AI generations and edits per user.

faqs.question: Can Eraser integrate with my codebase?
faqs.answer: Yes, Eraser connects with GitHub repositories to generate diagrams from live code and supports version control.

faqs.question: Is Eraser secure for enterprise use?
faqs.answer: Eraser is SOC II Type 2 certified and undergoes annual penetration testing to ensure enterprise-grade security.

faqs.question: Can I edit diagrams after AI generation?
faqs.answer: Yes, diagrams generated by Eraser AI can be edited using the platformâ€™s intuitive tools or by modifying the code.

faqs.question: Does Eraser use my data to train AI models?
faqs.answer: No, neither Eraser nor its LLM provider, OpenAI, uses user data to train AI models.

faqs.question: Is there an API for Eraser AI?
faqs.answer: Yes, Eraser AI offers an API for generating diagrams, available to Professional and Enterprise plan users.
